Others: Seiya Suzuki returned to the lineup for the Cubs’ 3-0 victory Saturday against the Reds and picked up right where he left off, going 2-for-2 with two walks.
A sprained right ankle had sidelined him for two games.
Suzuki (.283, 21 home runs, 73 RBI) essentially has replicated his production from 2023 in a season in which offense is down MLB-wide.
He entered Saturday hitting.330 with a.976 OPS in the last five weeks, putting him in the top 10 among qualified hitters in both categories.
Manager Craig Counsell praised Suzuki for his all-around offensive season and lamented the oblique strain that sidelined him for 3½ weeks in April and May.
